roleset.name: to make less effective, not sharp
roleset.note: BLUNT-V NOTES: Frames file for 'blunt' based on survey of sentences in the WSJ corpus. (from blunt.01-v predicate notes)
BLUNT-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on blunt-v.01. COrresponds to VNcls other_cos-45.5. (from blunt.02-j)

roles.note: arg0 from the verb not expected, but could be added if it appears. (from blunt.02-j)

example.name: transitive
example.text: Dr. Toseland , a toxicologist , said [0] he was preparing an article for a British forensic medical journal [*-2]raising the possibility that the deaths may have occurred after human insulin blunted critical warning signs indicating hypoglycemia , or low blood sugar , which [*T*-1] can kill diabetics .
example.arg: critical warning signs indicating hypoglycemia , or low blood sugar , which [*T*-1] can kill diabetics

example.name: Medical example
example.text: Lidocaine's primary value lies in its blunting of the airway reflexes and thus prevention of coughing.

example.name: the arg1
example.text: This was a falciform blade whose end was blunt, but the handle end was prolonged into a slender, rounded sound-like portion with a sharp point

roleset.name: candid, frank
roleset.note: BLUNT-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-1, comparison to frank.01. (from blunt.01-j)

example.name: arg0
example.text: *PRO* To be blunt while being honest ...

example.name: All args
example.text: I was blunt with her about what my motivation was, what my background was and she was very receptive.
example.arg: about what my motivation was, what my background was
